Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> On 6.5.2016 at 7:38 AM, tg626 said:
> 
> 
> No modder has control over when or if CKAN gets updated - I listed it's compatibility with 1.1.2 on spacedock.info beyond that it's out of my hands.
> 

Not completely, as long as your main download file linked in this thread from github is still marked as max 1.1.1:  
"KSP\_VERSION\_MAX":{"MAJOR":1,"MINOR":1,"PATCH":1}}

Which is the same as on spacedock.info, the download you offer there is marked as 1.1.1 max compatibility in "DockingSounds.version"

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-08T22:22:29Z" title="05/08/2016 10:22  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 8, 2016</time> by Tekener**

Are you sure? (Seriously I have no idea) because that's a file for KSP-AVC. Which due to how it handles checking is perfectly fine with that file in the archive.

If you know this to be a fact, I'd appreciate a reference to that documentation since CKAN is largely a mystery to me.  The only reason my mods are listed in it is because of that "include in ckan" check box that is/was on spacedock/kerbalstuff, and me thinking "Sure, why not?" and selecting it.

I can probably clear some things up. Before anything else I'm sorry our users are bugging you directly. CKAN users should be bugging CKAN for all CKAN-related issues. It's a message we've wholly failed to get across.

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> No modder has control over when or if CKAN gets updated - I listed it's compatibility with 1.1.2 on spacedock.info beyond that it's out of my hands.
> 

Modders determine their own level of involvement in how CKAN manages their metadata. Some write their own metadata and CKAN only references it, some simply ping us when something is wrong and some don't even know CKAN indexes their mod. [@Tekener](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/117427-tekener/) is half-correct: CKAN does indeed read the .version file in a given mod's zip. In the case of your mod you use a remote .version file so CKAN will prioritize that info over the local file (but only if the version of the mod in the remote version file matches the mod version).

The issue arose because the spacedock release was delayed. Within seconds of 2.1.1 hitting the spacedock server it was on CKAN. ~~Would it be best for us to target your github releases?~~ Just read a quote from you " Github is the master, spacedock the mirror." So we'll be changing where we pull releases to GitHub.

As for documentation for CKAN a decent primer might be [https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/wiki/Adding-a-mod-to-the-CKAN](https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/CKAN/wiki/Adding-a-mod-to-the-CKAN)

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-09T14:53:08Z" title="05/09/2016 02:53  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 9, 2016</time> by plague006**

Since this is a 1.1 plugin will it still work with 1.0.5

(No it does not)

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-11T18:51:12Z" title="05/11/2016 06:51  PM" data-short="8 yr">May 11, 2016</time> by Whovian41110**

I love this mod. Especially with the sounds provided by akron, this is awesome.  

Can't wait to dock again! ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-28T08:04:45Z" title="05/28/2016 08:04  AM" data-short="8 yr">May 28, 2016</time> by Cairol**
ANy update on if this wonderful mod will be updated?

I'm around ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Once Module Manager gets updated, we'll see if I need any updates.  This mod (and many others) relies on Module Manager for integration into the stock parts, so no <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr>, no DS. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

If it proves to be borked, then I probably won't update until the v1.2 final release.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-09-16T19:19:17Z" title="09/16/2016 07:19  PM" data-short="7 yr">September 16, 2016</time> by tg626**

I've recompiled Module Manager myself and found it to work during initial loading (no idea if the alt-F11 menu works, since I haven't tried it nor felt the need to try) -- it will at least patch the config database and generate a cache.  It's straightforward enough for testing purposes, at least.
Now that we have an official Module Manager release, you have a Docking Sounds release!  See the original post's download link.
Docking just hasn't been the same without the sound.  It just seems so much less satisfying.

Finally got around to installing this last night. Many thanks to [@tg626](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/112361-tg626/) for this great bit of ambiance.

Also, for [@Dashman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/76878-dashman/) I laughed so hard when I listened to your alternate docking sound. The old Star Trek door whoosh, and the "doi-oi-oi-oi-nnng" near the end, make it just perfectly Kerbal ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
Can confirm: Mod works with KSP v1.3.0
